textEditor

Class EditorEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • textEditor.Subject
      • textEditor.EditorEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEditorEngine

    public class EditorEngine
extends Subject
implements IEditorEngine
    A class present in the Mini-Text Editor implementation ever since version 1. It has been modified to support operations such as reverseCopy, reversePaste for version 2. Its other methods have been intensively refactored as the project reached its maturity state. To ensure loosely coupling, an IEditorEngine interface was developed.

      Executes paste's inverse command: removes the text that was previously inserted.

      • cut

        public void cut()
        Removes the selected text. Clears the current selection. Updates the text in the UI.
        Specified by:
        cut in interface IEditorEngine

      • cut

        public void cut(int startPos,
       java.lang.String textToCut)
        Removes textToCut.length() characters starting at position startPos. Clears the current selection. Updates the text in the UI.
        Specified by:
        cut in interface IEditorEngine
        Parameters:
        int - startPos The position where the cut begins
        String - textToCut The string that will be saved in the clipboard

      • enterText

        public void enterText(int startPos,
             int endPos,
             java.lang.String text)
        Depending on the start and end positions, it adds or removes characters from the buffer.
        Specified by:
        enterText in interface IEditorEngine
        Parameters:
        int - startPos The start position of the text to enter
        int - endPos The final position of the text to enter; useful for the inverse function
        String - text The text that will be saved in the buffer.

      • insertText

        public void insertText(int posToInsert,
              java.lang.String text)
                throws NegativeStartException,
                       ExceedLengthException
        This method is public just for testing purposes. Inserts the string received as argument in the buffer content starting at the position posToInsert.
        Parameters:
        posToInsert - Position where the string will be inserted.
        text - The string to be added in the buffer.
        Throws:
        NegativeStartException
        ExceedLengthException

      • isTextSelected

        public boolean isTextSelected()
        Specified by:
        isTextSelected in interface IEditorEngine
        Returns:
        Returns true if the selection is not empty. Returns false otherwise.

      • paste

        public void paste()
        paste Inserts the string in clipboard starting at the current position. Sets the current position at the end of the string inserted.
        Specified by:
        paste in interface IEditorEngine

      • paste

        public void paste(int startPos,
         java.lang.String textToPaste)
        paste Inserts the string textToPaste starting at the position received as parameter. Sets the current position at the end of the string inserted.
        Specified by:
        paste in interface IEditorEngine
        Parameters:
        int - startPos The position where the text will be inserted
        String - textToPaste The text that will be inserted.

      • removeText

        public void removeText(Pair<java.lang.Integer> p)
        This method is public just for testing purposes. Removes from the buffer the string situated at the positions received as parameter.

      • resetEditor

        public void resetEditor()
        Brings all member variables to the initial state: - caret position is set to 0 - the strings stored in clipboard and in the buffer are cleared - clears any existing selection
        Specified by:
        resetEditor in interface IEditorEngine

      • reverseCut

        public void reverseCut(int startPos,
              java.lang.String textToCut)
        Executes cut's inverse command. Inserts the text that was removed.
        Specified by:
        reverseCut in interface IEditorEngine

        reverseEnterText in interface IEditorEngine

      • reversePaste

        public void reversePaste(int startPos,
                java.lang.String textToPaste)
        Executes paste's inverse command: removes the text that was previously inserted.
        Specified by:
        reversePaste in interface IEditorEngine

      • setCurrentPos

        public void setCurrentPos(int currentPos)
        Sets the caret position to the value received as argument if the value is between the boundaries of the current text. Otherwise, the position is not changed.
        Specified by:
        setCurrentPos in interface IEditorEngine

      • setSelection

        public void setSelection(Pair<java.lang.Integer> p)
                  throws WrongSelectionEndException,
                         WrongSelectionStartException
        setSelection sets the current selection to the pair received as argument. If necessary, the values are swapped.
        Specified by:
        setSelection in interface IEditorEngine
        Parameters:
        Pair - p - the desired start and end positions of the selection
        Throws:
        WrongSelectionEndException - if the end position exceeds the length of the current text
        WrongSelectionStartException - if the start position is smaller than 0

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String _text)
        To be used only for testing purposes. The text should be manipulated only through copy, cut, paste methods. Sets the buffer text to the value received as argument.
